intro: Melilotoides schachimardanica, commonly known as the Schachimardan melilot, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, particularly in Armenia and Azerbaijan. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. The Schachimardan melilot is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat.
